items.item_details:
Members of the public may address the Retirement Board on any subject not on tonight’s agenda; however, provisions of the Brown Act (Government Code Section 54954.2(a) and 54954.3) preclude any action.  As an unagendized item, no response is required from the Retirement Board or District staff and no action can be taken; however, the Retirement Board may instruct the Superintendent to agendize the item for a future meeting.  When your name is called, please come to the podium, state your name for the record, and limit your remarks to three (3) minutes.
	 
Persons wishing to address the Retirement Board must fill out a gold request form, which is located at the entrance of the Board Room.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT 
Item:  6.04
TO:
Board of Trustees
FROM:  
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
SUBJECT:
Discussion/Action to Retain a Qualified Actuary to Prepare a Valuation
					 
					 
Section 3(g)(ii) of the Retirement Board Bylaws provides that the Board shall prepare tri-ennial valuation of the Retirement System’s assets conducted by a qualified actuary.  To accomplish that, the Board needs to authorize the solicitation of services and retention of a qualified actuary to prepare the required valuation.
					 
FINANCIAL IMPACT:
To be determined
					 
FUNDING SOURCE:
General Fund
					 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees direct and approve the solicitation and retention of services in accordance with District procurement practices for professional services for a qualified actuary to prepare the required valuation.

Item:  6.05
TO:
Board of Trustees
FROM:  
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
SUBJECT:
Discussion/Action to Retain a Qualified Auditor to Review the System's Financial Statements per Section 3(g) of the Bylaws
					 
					 
Section 3(g)(iii) of the Retirement Board Bylaws provides that the Board shall retain a qualified auditor to review the System’s financial statements.  To accomplish that, the Board needs to authorize the solicitation of services and retention of a qualified auditor to conduct the required review.
					 
					 
FINANCIAL IMPACT:
To be determined
					 
FUNDING SOURCE:
General Fund 
					 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees direct and approve the solicitation and retention of services in accordance with District procurement practices for professional services for a qualified auditor to prepare the required review.
